hpnicfDot11WIDS.name: hpnicfDot11WIDS

revisions.description: Add new nodes and table to support new featrues of WIDS.
Add new nodes to support new featrues of WIDS.
To fix bugs in the MIB file.
To fix bugs in the MIB file.
The initial revision of this MIB module.

hpnicfDot11WIDS.description: This MIB provides information about WIDS feature. GLOSSARY Wireless Intrusion Detection Sensor (WIDS) WIDS is designed to be employed in an area that is serviced by an existing wireless network. It aids in the early detection of malicious outsider attacks and intrusions via wireless networks. Rogue AP A rogue access point is any Wi-Fi access point connected to the network without authorization. As it is not authorized, if there is any weakness in the AP, the hacker will have chance to compromise the network. Rogue Station It is similiar to Rogue AP, while it is a station. Monitor AP An AP will scan or listen to the air, and try to detect wireless attack in the network. Some AP products will work only in monitor role, while some AP products could switch between normal AP role (only provide wireless access service)and monitor AP role. Ad Hoc Mode Station could work under Ad hoc mode, then they could directly do peer-to-peer communication without other device support.

HpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType.name: HpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType
HpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType.description: Represents whether the detected device is permitted or a rogue.

HpnicfDot11WIDSAtkType.name: HpnicfDot11WIDSAtkType
HpnicfDot11WIDSAtkType.description: The type of attack. This object has following defined values: 'act': Action Frame 'asr': Association Request 'aur': Authentication Request 'daf': Deauthentication Frame 'dar': Disassociation Request 'ndf': Null Data Frame 'pbr': Probe Request 'rar': Reassociation Request 'saf': Spoofed Disassociation Frame 'sdf': Spoofed Deauthentication Frame 'wiv': Weak IV Detected

hpnicfDot11WIDSScanMode.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSScanMode
hpnicfDot11WIDSScanMode.description: Represents the scope of channels to be scanned. The following value are supported all(1) - Do scan on all the channels. auto(2) - Do scan for the channels that automatically selected by WIDS.

hpnicfDot11WIDSScanChannelList.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSScanChannelList
hpnicfDot11WIDSScanChannelList.description: Represents the channel scope to be scanned when hpnicfDot11WIDSScanMode is configurated as channelSpec mode. Each channel value will be separated by comma character.

hpnicfDot11DevAgingTime.name: hpnicfDot11DevAgingTime
hpnicfDot11DevAgingTime.description: Represents the age time for entries in the detected device table. If an entry is not detected within the interval, it is deleted from the detected device table. If the deleted entry is that of a rogue, it is added into the rogue history table.

hpnicfDot11DynBlkListEnable.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlkListEnable
hpnicfDot11DynBlkListEnable.description: Represents whether the dynamic blacklist feature is enabled or not. 'true' : Enable the dynamic blacklist feature to filter out unwanted clients, which will not get associated. 'false' : Disable the dynamic blacklist feature.

hpnicfDot11DynBlkListLifeTime.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlkListLifeTime
hpnicfDot11DynBlkListLifeTime.description: Represents the lifetime for dynamic blacklist entries. If a dynamic blacklist entry is not detected within the lifetime, the entry will be removed from the dynamic blacklist. The lifetime becomes active only if dynamic blacklist feature is enabled.

hpnicfDot11FloodAtkDctEnable.name: hpnicfDot11FloodAtkDctEnable
hpnicfDot11FloodAtkDctEnable.description: Represents whether detection of flood attack is enabled or not. 'true' : Enable the detection of flood attack. 'false' : Disable the detection of flood attack.

hpnicfDot11SpoofAtkDctEnable.name: hpnicfDot11SpoofAtkDctEnable
hpnicfDot11SpoofAtkDctEnable.description: Represents whether detection of Spoof attack is enabled or not. 'true' : Enable the detection of Spoof attack. 'false' : Disable the detection of Spoof attack.

hpnicfDot11WeakIVAtkDctEnable.name: hpnicfDot11WeakIVAtkDctEnable
hpnicfDot11WeakIVAtkDctEnable.description: Represents whether detection of weak-iv attack is enabled or not. 'true' : Enable the detection of weak-iv attack. 'false' : Disable the detection of weak-iv attack.

hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSRogueHistory.name: hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSRogueHistory
hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSRogueHistory.description: This object is used to clear all entries from the rogue history table. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSHistroy.name: hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSHistroy
hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSHistroy.description: This object is used to clear the history information of attacks detected in the WLAN system. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSStatistics.name: hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSStatistics
hpnicfDot11ResetWIDSStatistics.description: This object is used to clear the statistics of attacks detected in the WLAN system. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDynBlkList.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDynBlkList
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDynBlkList.description: This object is used to remove all entries from the dynamic blacklist. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllStcBlkList.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllStcBlkList
hpnicfDot11ResetAllStcBlkList.description: This object is used to remove all entries from the static blacklist. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllWhtBlkList.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllWhtBlkList
hpnicfDot11ResetAllWhtBlkList.description: This object is used to remove all entries from the static whitelist. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueAP.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueAP
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueAP.description: This object is used to clear the information of all detected rogue APs. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueSta.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueSta
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctRogueSta.description: This object is used to clear the information of all detected rogue clients. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctAdhoc.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctAdhoc
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctAdhoc.description: This object is used to clear the information of all detected ad hoc devices. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctDevice.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctDevice
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctDevice.description: This object is used to clear the information of all detected devices. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctSSID.name: hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctSSID
hpnicfDot11ResetAllDctSSID.description: This object is used to clear the information of all detected SSIDs. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11WidsFloodInterval.name: hpnicfDot11WidsFloodInterval
hpnicfDot11WidsFloodInterval.description: The interval of WIDS flood detection.

hpnicfDot11WidsBlackListThreshold.name: hpnicfDot11WidsBlackListThreshold
hpnicfDot11WidsBlackListThreshold.description: When flood attack exceeds the value of this node, the MAC address will be added into black list.

hpnicfDot11SSIDFilterOnOff.name: hpnicfDot11SSIDFilterOnOff
hpnicfDot11SSIDFilterOnOff.description: Represents whether the SSID permit feature is enabled or not.

hpnicfDot11BSSIDFilterOnOff.name: hpnicfDot11BSSIDFilterOnOff
hpnicfDot11BSSIDFilterOnOff.description: Represents whether the BSSID permit feature is enabled or not.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorTable.description: The table provides the permitted vendor list, and each vendor will be identified by OUI. The legal device should be made by the permitted vendors.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitVendorEntry.description: Each entry provides the information of permitted vendor.

hpnicfDot11VendorOUI.name: hpnicfDot11VendorOUI
hpnicfDot11VendorOUI.description: Represents the vendor OUI information of the wireless device.

hpnicfDot11PermitVendorRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11PermitVendorRowStatus
hpnicfDot11PermitVendorRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11VendorName.name: hpnicfDot11VendorName
hpnicfDot11VendorName.description: Represents the vendor name of the wireless device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDTable.description: The table represents the list of SSID could be permitted in the wireless network.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitSSIDEntry.description: Each entry provides the information of permitted SSID.

hpnicfDot11PermitSSID.name: hpnicfDot11PermitSSID
hpnicfDot11PermitSSID.description: Represents the permitted SSID in the wireless network.

hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDRowStatus
hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDDetected.name: hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDDetected
hpnicfDot11PermitSSIDDetected.description: Represents whether the permitted SSID is detected or not.

hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListTable.description: The table provides the MAC address list of stations or APs, and WIDS always take them as legal stations or APs.

hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListEntry.description: Each entry contains the MAC address of station or AP, and WIDS always take it as legal station or AP.

hpnicfDot11IgnoreMAC.name: hpnicfDot11IgnoreMAC
hpnicfDot11IgnoreMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of station or AP, and WIDS always take it as legal station or AP.

hpnicfDot11IgnoreListRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11IgnoreListRowStatus
hpnicfDot11IgnoreListRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11IgnoreMACDetected.name: hpnicfDot11IgnoreMACDetected
hpnicfDot11IgnoreMACDetected.description: Represents whether the MAC address detected or not.

hpnicfDot11IgnoreDevType.name: hpnicfDot11IgnoreDevType
hpnicfDot11IgnoreDevType.description: Represents the type of the MAC address detected. The value of this object always is unknown if the MAC address is not detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListTable.description: The table provides the MAC address list of rogue APs or rogue stations, the WIDS will take countermeasure as per the MAC address list.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSAttackListEntry.description: Each entry contains the MAC address of rogue AP or rogue station, and the countermeasure will be taken for it.

hpnicfDot11AttackDeviceMac.name: hpnicfDot11AttackDeviceMac
hpnicfDot11AttackDeviceMac.description: Represents the MAC address of rogue AP or rogue station, and the countermeasure will be taken for it.

hpnicfDot11AttackListRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11AttackListRowStatus
hpnicfDot11AttackListRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11AttackDevDetected.name: hpnicfDot11AttackDevDetected
hpnicfDot11AttackDevDetected.description: Represents whether the assigned MAC address in attack list is detected or not.

hpnicfDot11AttackDevType.name: hpnicfDot11AttackDevType
hpnicfDot11AttackDevType.description: Represents the type of detected MAC address in attack list. If the MAC address is not detected, it will return unknown(5) for get operation.

hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListTable.name: hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListTable
hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListTable.description: The table provides the information of whitelist.

hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListEntry
hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListEntry.description: Each entry contains the information of whitelist.

hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListMAC.name: hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListMAC
hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListMAC.description: Represents the MAC addresses in whitelist.

hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListRowStatus
hpnicfDot11StaticWhiteListRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListTable.name: hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListTable
hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListTable.description: The table provides the information of static blacklist.

hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListEntry
hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListEntry.description: Each entry contains the information of static blacklist.

hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListMAC.name: hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListMAC
hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListMAC.description: Represents the MAC addresses in static blacklist.

hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListRowStatus
hpnicfDot11StaticBlackListRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDTable.description: The table represents the list of BSSID could be permitted in the wireless network.

hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSPermitBSSIDEntry.description: Each entry provides the information of permitted BSSID.

hpnicfDot11PermitBSSID.name: hpnicfDot11PermitBSSID
hpnicfDot11PermitBSSID.description: Represents the permitted BSSID in the wireless network.

hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDDetected.name: hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDDetected
hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDDetected.description: Represents whether the permitted BSSID is detected or not.

hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDRowStatus
hpnicfDot11PermitBSSIDRowStatus.description: Represents the row status of permit BSSID table.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPTable.description: The table represents the list of possible BSS information for rogue APs detected by the WIDS.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPEntry.description: Each entry contains possible BSS information of each rogue AP detected by WIDS.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPBSSMAC.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPBSSMAC
hpnicfDot11RogueAPBSSMAC.description: Represents the BSS MAC address of rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPVendorName.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPVendorName
hpnicfDot11RogueAPVendorName.description: Represents the vendor name of rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPMonitorNum.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPMonitorNum
hpnicfDot11RogueAPMonitorNum.description: Represents the number of monitor APs which detected the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTm.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTm
hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTm.description: Represents the time that AP was detected as a rogue AP for the first time.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTm.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTm
hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTm.description: Represents the time that AP was detected as a rogue AP for the last time.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPSSID.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPSSID
hpnicfDot11RogueAPSSID.description: Represents the SSID broadcasted by rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPMaxSigStrength.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPMaxSigStrength
hpnicfDot11RogueAPMaxSigStrength.description: Represents the maximal value of signal strength that WIDS received from the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPChannel.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPChannel
hpnicfDot11RogueAPChannel.description: Represents on which radio channel of the rogue AP the maximal signal strength was received.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPBeaconInterval.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPBeaconInterval
hpnicfDot11RogueAPBeaconInterval.description: Represents the interval for Beacon management frame of rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPAttackedStatus.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPAttackedStatus
hpnicfDot11RogueAPAttackedStatus.description: Represents whether the countermeasure have taken for the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPToIgnore.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPToIgnore
hpnicfDot11RogueAPToIgnore.description: Represents whether the rogue AP will be taken as a rogue AP. If the value is true, NMS should not display the rogue AP as NMS display rogue AP list, and the MAC address will be automatically added into hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListTable. If the value is false, NMS will take it as a rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPEncryptStatus.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPEncryptStatus
hpnicfDot11RogueAPEncryptStatus.description: Represents whether the rogue AP encrypt the frame or not.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPReset.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPReset
hpnicfDot11RogueAPReset.description: This object is used to clear information of assigned AP. The information of AP which detect assigned rogue AP will be cleared together. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTmStr.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTmStr
hpnicfDot11RogueAPFirstDetectTmStr.description: Represents the time that AP was detected as a rogue AP for the first time.

hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTmStr.name: hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTmStr
hpnicfDot11RogueAPLastDetectTmStr.description: Represents the time that AP was detected as a rogue AP for the last time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtTable.description: As each rogue AP could be detected by multiple monitor APs, each monitor AP could have some kind of detailed information about a specific rogue AP. In the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPTable table, the detailed information for a specific rogue AP will be summarized from information in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtTable table. For example, multiple monitor APs could receive RF signal of one rogue AP, and each monitor AP has its maximum signal strength by itself. The information will be kept as hpnicfDot11DetectMaxAPSigStrength in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtTable table. While only the maximum value among all the hpnicfDot11DetectMaxAPSigStrength for each monitor AP will be kept in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPTable as hpnicfDot11RogueAPMaxSigStrength.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueAPExtEntry.description: Each entry contains information of the rogue AP detected by each monitor AP.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAPID.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAPID
hpnicfDot11WIDSAPID.description: To uniquely identify each AP, and relation-ship between hpnicfDot11WIDSAPID and AP device will be static.

hpnicfDot11DetectCurAPSigStrength.name: hpnicfDot11DetectCurAPSigStrength
hpnicfDot11DetectCurAPSigStrength.description: Represents the current value of signal strength that WIDS monitor AP received from the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11DetectAPByChannel.name: hpnicfDot11DetectAPByChannel
hpnicfDot11DetectAPByChannel.description: Represents on which radio channel that WIDS monitor AP detected the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11DetectAPByRadioID.name: hpnicfDot11DetectAPByRadioID
hpnicfDot11DetectAPByRadioID.description: Represents on which radio the monitor AP has detected the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11AttackAPStatus.name: hpnicfDot11AttackAPStatus
hpnicfDot11AttackAPStatus.description: Represents whether monitor AP have taken countermeasure on the rogue AP.

hpnicfDot11DetectAPFirstTm.name: hpnicfDot11DetectAPFirstTm
hpnicfDot11DetectAPFirstTm.description: Represents the time that monitor AP detected the rogue AP for the first time.

hpnicfDot11DetectAPLastTm.name: hpnicfDot11DetectAPLastTm
hpnicfDot11DetectAPLastTm.description: Represents the time that monitor AP detected the rogue AP for the last time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaTable.description: The table represents the list of rogue stations detected by the WIDS.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaEntry.description: Each entry contains information of each rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaMAC.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaMAC
hpnicfDot11RogueStaMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaVendorName.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaVendorName
hpnicfDot11RogueStaVendorName.description: Represents the vendor name of rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaMonitorNum.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaMonitorNum
hpnicfDot11RogueStaMonitorNum.description: Represents the number of monitor APs which detected the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTm.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTm
hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTm.description: Represents the time that station was detected as a rogue station for the first time.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTm.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTm
hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTm.description: Represents the time that station was detected as a rogue station for the last time.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaAccessBSSID.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaAccessBSSID
hpnicfDot11RogueStaAccessBSSID.description: Represents BSS MAC address that rogue station try to access.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaMaxSigStrength.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaMaxSigStrength
hpnicfDot11RogueStaMaxSigStrength.description: Represents the maximal value of signal strength that WIDS received from the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaChannel.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaChannel
hpnicfDot11RogueStaChannel.description: Represents on which radio channel the maximal signal strength was received.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaAttackedStatus.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaAttackedStatus
hpnicfDot11RogueStaAttackedStatus.description: Represents whether the countermeasure have taken for the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaToIgnore.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaToIgnore
hpnicfDot11RogueStaToIgnore.description: Represents whether the rogue AP will be taken as a rogue station. If the value is true, NMS should not display the rogue station as NMS display rogue station list, and the MAC address will be automatically added into hpnicfDot11WIDSIgnoreListTable. If the value is false, NMS will take it as a rogue station.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaAdHocStatus.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaAdHocStatus
hpnicfDot11RogueStaAdHocStatus.description: Represents whether the rogue station work on the Ad Hoc mode or not.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaReset.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaReset
hpnicfDot11RogueStaReset.description: This object is used to clear information of assigned station. The information of AP which detects assigned rogue station will be cleared together. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTmStr.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTmStr
hpnicfDot11RogueStaFirstDetectTmStr.description: Represents the time that station was detected as a rogue station for the first time.

hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTmStr.name: hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTmStr
hpnicfDot11RogueStaLastDetectTmStr.description: Represents the time that station was detected as a rogue station for the last time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtTable.description: As each rogue station could be detected by multiple monitor APs, each monitor AP could have some kind of detailed information about a specific rogue station. In the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaTable table, the detailed information for a specific rogue station will be summarized from information in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtTable table. For example, multiple monitor APs could receive RF signal of one rogue station, and each monitor AP has its maximum signal strength by itself. The information will be kept as hpnicfDot11DetectMaxStaSigStrength in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtTable table. While only the maximum value among all the hpnicfDot11DetectMaxStaSigStrength for each monitor AP will be kept in the hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaTable as hpnicfDot11RogueStaMaxSigStrength.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueStaExtEntry.description: Each entry contains information of rogue station detected by each monitor AP.

hpnicfDot11DetectCurStaSigStrength.name: hpnicfDot11DetectCurStaSigStrength
hpnicfDot11DetectCurStaSigStrength.description: Represents the current value of signal strength that WIDS monitor AP received from the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11DetectStaByChannel.name: hpnicfDot11DetectStaByChannel
hpnicfDot11DetectStaByChannel.description: Represents on which radio channel the maximal signal strength was received.

hpnicfDot11DetectStaByRadioID.name: hpnicfDot11DetectStaByRadioID
hpnicfDot11DetectStaByRadioID.description: Represents which radio on the monitor AP has detected the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11AttackStaStatus.name: hpnicfDot11AttackStaStatus
hpnicfDot11AttackStaStatus.description: Represents whether monitor AP have taken countermeasure for the rogue station.

hpnicfDot11DetectStaFirstTm.name: hpnicfDot11DetectStaFirstTm
hpnicfDot11DetectStaFirstTm.description: Represents the time that monitor AP detected the rogue station for the first time.

hpnicfDot11DetectStaLastTm.name: hpnicfDot11DetectStaLastTm
hpnicfDot11DetectStaLastTm.description: Represents the time that monitor AP detected the rogue station for the last time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevTable.description: This Table contains information of detected devices.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectedDevEntry.description: Each entry contains information of detected devices.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMAC.description: Represents MAC address of the device detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevType.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevType
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevType.description: Represents type of the device detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevPermitType.description: Represents whether the device detected is a rogue device or not.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevVendor.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevVendor
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevVendor.description: Represents Vendor of the detected device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMonitorNum.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMonitorNum
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMonitorNum.description: Represents the number of active APs that detect the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSSID.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSSID
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSSID.description: Represents the service set identifier for the ESS of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBSSID.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBSSID
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBSSID.description: Represents the basic service set identifier of the detected device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevChannel.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevChannel
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevChannel.description: Represents the channel in which the device was last detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMaxRSSI.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMaxRSSI
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevMaxRSSI.description: Represents the maximum detected RSSI of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBeaconIntvl.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBeaconIntvl
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevBeaconIntvl.description: Represents the beacon interval for the detected AP.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevFstDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevFstDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevFstDctTime.description: Represents the time at which the device was first detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevLstDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevLstDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevLstDctTime.description: Represents the time at which the rogue AP was detected last time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevReset.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevReset
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevReset.description: This object is used to clears the information of the device detected in the WLAN. It will return false for get operation.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSnr.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSnr
hpnicfDot11WIDSDevSnr.description: Represents SNR of the device detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPTable.description: This Table contains information of the AP which detected device in the WLAN.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPEntry.description: Each entry contains information of the AP which detected device in the WLAN.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of the AP that detected the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPName.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPName
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPName.description: Represents the name of the AP that detected the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPRadioID.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPRadioID
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPRadioID.description: Represents the radio index of the AP that detected the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMaxRSSI.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMaxRSSI
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPMaxRSSI.description: Represents the maximum detected RSSI of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPFstDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPFstDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPFstDctTime.description: Represents the time at which the rogue AP was detected first time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPLstDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPLstDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSRptAPLstDctTime.description: Represents the time at which the rogue AP was detected last time.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTable.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTable
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTable.description: This table contains information of dynamic blacklist entries.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListEntry
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListEntry.description: Each entry contains information of dynamic blacklist.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListMAC.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListMAC
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of the device inserted into the dynamic blacklist.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTime.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTime
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTime.description: Represents the time elapsed since the entry was last updated.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReason.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReason
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReason.description: Represents the reason why the entry was added into the dynamic blacklist.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReset.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReset
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListReset.description: This object is used to remove designated entry from the dynamic blacklist. The value which read from this object always is false.

hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTimeTicks.name: hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTimeTicks
hpnicfDot11DynBlackListTimeTicks.description: Represents the time elapsed since the entry was last updated in units TimeTicks.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryTable.description: This table contains information of all expired rogue devices which have been deleted from the list of detected rogue devices because they could not be detected within the device aging duration.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHistoryEntry.description: Each entry contains information of an expired rogue device which has been deleted from the list of detected rogue devices because they could not be detected within the device aging duration.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisVendor.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisVendor
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisVendor.description: Represents the vendor for the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisType.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisType
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisType.description: Represents the type of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisChl.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisChl
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisChl.description: Represents the channel in which the device was last detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisSSID.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisSSID
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisSSID.description: Represents the service set identifier for the ESS of the device.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisLastDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisLastDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueHisLastDctTime.description: Represents the time at which the device was last detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyTable.description: This table contains information of the history of attacks detected in the WLAN system.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHistroyEntry.description: Each entry contains information of the history of attacks detected in the WLAN system.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisMAC.description: Represents the Mac address. In case of spoof attacks, this field provides the BSSID which was spoofed. In case of other attacks, this field provides the MAC address of the device which initiated the attack.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisChl.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisChl
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisChl.description: Represents the channel in which the attack was detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisRSSI.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisRSSI
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisRSSI.description: Represents the average RSSI of the designated attack.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisDctTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisDctTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisDctTime.description: Represents the time at which this attack was detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisAPName.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisAPName
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkHisAPName.description: Represents the name of the AP which detected this attack.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasStartTime.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasStartTime
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasStartTime.description: Represents current attack tracking time. It is started at the system startup and is refreshed each hour subsequently.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTable.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTable
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTable.description: This table contains information of the counts of attacks detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasEntry.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasEntry
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasEntry.description: Each entry contains information of the counts of attacks detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasCurCnt.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasCurCnt
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasCurCnt.description: Represents the count of attacks detected since the time specified by the current attack tracking time. The current attack tracking time is started at the system startup and is refreshed each hour subsequently.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTotalCnt.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTotalCnt
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkStasTotalCnt.description: Represents the total count of the attacks detected since the system startup.

hpnicfDot11BlackListTable.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListTable
hpnicfDot11BlackListTable.description: This table contains information of blacklist entries, including dynamic and static.

hpnicfDot11BlackListEntry.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListEntry
hpnicfDot11BlackListEntry.description: Each entry contains information of blacklist.

hpnicfDot11BlackListMAC.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListMAC
hpnicfDot11BlackListMAC.description: This object represents the MAC address of the device inserted into the table.

hpnicfDot11BlackListTime.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListTime
hpnicfDot11BlackListTime.description: Represents the time elapsed since the entry was last updated. If it is static blacklist, the value is always 0.

hpnicfDot11BlackListReason.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListReason
hpnicfDot11BlackListReason.description: Represents the reason why the entry was added into the blacklist.

hpnicfDot11BlackListRowStatus.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListRowStatus
hpnicfDot11BlackListRowStatus.description: This object represents the status of this table entry.

hpnicfDot11BlackListTimeTicks.name: hpnicfDot11BlackListTimeTicks
hpnicfDot11BlackListTimeTicks.description: Represents the time elapsed since the entry was last updated in timetick. If it is static blacklist, the value is always 0.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectRogueTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectRogueTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectRogueTrap.description: The notification represents that a rogue AP or a station was detected by WIDS. The NMS would refer to MIB table under hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectGroup group to get more detailed information.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocTrap.description: The notification represents a rogue Ad hoc station was detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSUnauthorSSIDTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSUnauthorSSIDTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSUnauthorSSIDTrap.description: The notification represents which unauthorized SSID are accessed in the network. The notification will be sent to NMS when an unauthorized SSID is detected on the network for the first time.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDisappearRogueTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDisappearRogueTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSDisappearRogueTrap.description: The notification represents that a rogue device has aged out and moved to history table or the device type has been changed to friendly. The notification will be sent to NMS whenever a rogue disappears.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectAttack.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectAttack
hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectAttack.description: This notification occurs when some type of attack is detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectWBridge.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectWBridge
hpnicfDot11WIDSDetectWBridge.description: This notification occurs whenever a detected device is classified as rogue wireless-bridge.

hpnicfDot11WIDSFloodTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSFloodTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSFloodTrap.description: This notification occurs when flood attack is detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSSpoofTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSSpoofTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSSpoofTrap.description: This notification occurs when spoof attack is detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSWeakIVTrap.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSWeakIVTrap
hpnicfDot11WIDSWeakIVTrap.description: This notification occurs when weak IV attack is detected.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueMAC.description: Represents which rogue AP or station.

hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueType.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueType
hpnicfDot11WIDSRogueType.description: Represents the rogue type. The following value are supported rogueAp(1) - A rogue AP rogueStation(2) - A rogue Station

hpnicfDot11WIDSMonitorMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSMonitorMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSMonitorMAC.description: Represents which monitor detected the rogue AP or station.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocMAC.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocMAC
hpnicfDot11WIDSAdHocMAC.description: Represents the MAC address of Ad hoc station.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkMac.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkMac
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkMac.description: Represents mac address of attack source.

hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkDestMac.name: hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkDestMac
hpnicfDot11WIDSAtkDestMac.description: Represents mac address of attack destination.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Fri May 24 19:29:35 2019
